result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Mennenga was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12/15/2016 with payment plan fee of $15.00 to be added.
Alternate 30 days jail.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L Mennenga

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11/19/16 Letter from Lowell Mennenga
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert L Mennenga in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 of the Amended Information,  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:

Count 1:

FINE: $2,793.00

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00

DRGOD:  $10.00 (inlcuded in fine already)

To be paid at the rate of $50.00/month commencing 12/15/16 or serve 30 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Jury status hearing on November 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
